page.title: 03COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: There is only one shop in BURTON HASTINGS which is a Post Office which also sells confectionery. This buillding dates from 1830 and used to be a garage. There is one telephone box for the 200 inhabitants.The population has to travel out of the village to Wolvey, Nuneaton or Hinckley for their entertainment since there is no public house, cinema or community meeting place in the village. The nearest garage is in Wolvey or Nuneaton and there is an infrequent 'bus service.The newspapers come from Nuneaton and Hinckley and are delivered by local residents.Children have to travel by 'bus to school in Wolvey until they are 12 years old when they transfer to Bedworth.Some of the women have formed a catering business and prepare food for functions in the area.
